metadata.title: CVE-2019-17014 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
If an image had not loaded correctly (such as when it is not actually an image), it could be dragged and dropped cross-domain, resulting in a cross-origin information leak. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-17014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
